That being said, our table remained piled with dishes, drinks were never refilled, and after a TWO HOUR DINNER at Fat Choy, most of that time in waiting, I waived the white flag and approached the counter to pay for my bill while we waited for our last order of bao to come out.

The bao this evening was slightly different, heavier on the pickled greens, folded in cold bao instead of steamed bun, fingerprints of sauce on the buns from the cook, and it lacked the crushed peanuts on top.  Our potstickers were more greasy than our first two times at Fat Choy, and those took an additional 30 minutes because the server failed to write our order down properly the first time.  

With that being said, we will seek out another bao place in town.  Service is everything to me, and after last night, this place is not worth returning to if the service and quality of food can be that inconsistent.

I'm hooked on bao! We came here especially for their duck bao and pork belly bao but they were all out of the pork belly so we settled on two orders of the duck bao and an order of the short rib grilled cheese. The waitress was very nice but she must have misunderstood us and only gave us one order of the duck bao instead of two orders. It was near closing time so we didn't want to say anything. 

The duck bao is definitely something I would get again on my next visit. It was very tasty but small, I guess that's why it's listed under snacks on the menu. Two pieces of bao come in one order so the boyfriend and I shared. We also shared the short rib grilled cheese, and OMG, I want all my grilled cheese sandwiches from now on to taste like the grilled cheese sandwich I had from here. The meat was so tender and tasty.

The restaurant is small and very casual, and is located inside the Eureka Casino which is a small, smoked-filled casino on East Sahara. I don't usually come to this part of town so I had never even heard of the casino until I read about Fat Choy. The cigarette smell/smoke is horrible inside the casino but once you're in the restaurant, it's not too bad. 

There were many other things on the menu that looked really good so I will definitely be returning and hopefully they won't be all out of the pork belly bao.

I had the pork belly bao and it was so damn good I'm already planning my return trip!
This little diner is inside a small of the strip casino in a not so great neighborhood but that is beside the point just go,eat and be happy!
Hands down the best pork belly bao in Las Vegas!!! The Won Ton Soup also a winner...add noodles for $2 more.  Another champion dish is the sesame noodles....add pork belly!!! Love this place!!!

Food was alright.  Service is horrible.  Just two of us this evening, restaurant not even half full.  We ordered one appetizer and then one entree each.  An hour later one entree came out, 5 minutes later the other entree came out. 5 minutes after that we got our appetizer.  Kitchen had no idea what they were doing. Servers were yelling back to them from the pass. Won't go there again.

Found this through the LV Weekly.
It is so good, don't let the outside fool you.
I had the burger and bao and it was amazing.
I want to try other things on the menu, but I'm just consistently blown away by their pork belly plates that I haven't ventured that far yet.

Went here for a late lunch Friday afternoon.  Had the duck bao, pork bao, and the grilled cheese.  We wanted to try the bone marrow but they were 86ed.  Both the duck and pork bao were delicious.  All the ingredients were super fresh and you could tell there was a lot of love putting them together.  The meats were juicy and perfectly cooked.  There was delicious duck fat dribbling down my arm when I took the first bite.  YUM!  The pork fat was melt in your mouth good.  
The short rib grilled cheese on the other hand, was disappointing.  The menu said cheddar cheese but to us, it really tasted like Kraft American slices.  I'm pretty sure I can distinguish the difference between cheddar and American.  Onion jam you say?  What onion jam?  Couldn't taste it.  The tomato dip on the side should be renamed "warm jarred marinara" as that's exactly what it tasted like.  I thought since there was so much TLC poured into the baos that maybe the owners would have done something unique for their fries.  But nope, they're just mass produced, store bought, frozen. 

Service was fine, I was expecting to have to wait for a long time after reading others' reviews, but maybe it was because there were only 2 other tables in the restaurant when we were there. 

The ambiance and location SUCKED!!  The restaurant is located in the Eureka Casino and it's an open door leading into the restaurant - It was seriously like sitting in an ashtray while trying to eat.  The smoke was overwhelming and it was hard to enjoy our meal. 

I'm not sure if I will be back - don't get me wrong..  the bao were sooo good!  But being a non-smoker, I'm not sure I can handle sitting in a gross old building with second hand smoke as my complimentary side.

Nooooo! I wanted to love this place but they were out of the short rib I had expressly visited Fat Choy for! Small little place inside the Eureka casino off strip with pretty limited seating, so be prepared to wait. Not too bad, though, just hunker down and wait for it, I promise, it's worth it. As I mentioned, I went in hoping for some pork belly but it was not meant to be, they were out. We settled for the duck bao and he won ton soup. Both were excellent and made their way toward our table swiftly. Fat Choy is an interesting mix of truck stop/deli counter top with Las Vegas casino charm. Stop by and take a gander at their menu, who knows, you may fall in love with their baos.

Delicious food and amazing service!! I had the sesame noodles, tofu bao and soft shell crab bao which was a seasonal item. All 3 dishes had great flavor, spice and all prepared so freshly. Loved the atmosphere and can't get much better food or bang for your buck when dining at Fat Choy. It is well worth the short trip off the strip and feels like a home cooked meal.

Thank you to Emily and her staff for a great lunch. We will back to the next time we are in Vegas!!!

Great place!!  Must try the pork belly bao and the sesame noodles they are AMAZING!!!!  Very nice and clean great service.  The only thing that i was kinda bummed is that they don't have a Lunch Menu I think that would be gret if they did.  Other than that it is a must try.

This place is the real deal, made from scratch, pot stickers and wonton soup, the wontons and the broth, both are insane... Bao with pork belly and crushed peanuts was perfect, Bao with Peking duck is my new favorite. 

Don't be fooled by the dive appearance, this place takes its food seriously with some great traditional flavors. 

Even the soda machine had perfect settings!

Thank you Mary Jo for being super sweet and awesome. Great spot!

Excellent service and excellent food for reasonable prices 
In a sketch casino but don't let that turn you away from the amazing food!

Great flavors in every bite. Pork belly bao is a must try as well as the short rib grilled cheese.....mmmmmmm factor is a +5!  The Fat Choy burger bursts with the fried egg oozing  all over the burger pattie, pork belly and short rib and covered  with a brioche  bun.
Delicious! Ask for the sauce that comes with the pork belly bao even if you don't order the dish. You can literally use the sauce to dip anything!

First time finding out about this place through a friend on Facebook and she suggested the Fat Choy Burger at the Fat Choy restaurant inside  of the Eureka casino. 
So I made it the next day to the Eureka Casino and my  observation  it was a very quaint very clean neighborhood casino so, I made it inside the Fat Choy and,  it too was very quaint and very cozy atmosphere.

 The server was very attentive and very nice as she greeted me so, I  told her that it was my first time there and that I heard the Fat Choy Burger was poplar and she agreed with me and went on to tell me burger ingredients with such enthusiasm which to me it sounded really enticing so, I ordered it along with a Buddha Beer. 

Shortly my order arrived and I was pleasantly surprised how big the burger was. The burger is 1/2 pound of  Angus beef and consisted of the following toppings of boneless short ribs, bacon, cheddar cheese, roasted tomato and , a fried egg on a fresh bun. 

All I  have to say the burger didn't last very long on my plate it was Deeeeelicious!! After devouring my burger treat I also noticed on their menu they had pork belly which I  haven't tried before so, I ordered a small portion of  pork belly slices which shortly arrived and  it had a fatty kind of bland flavor but, with a little tobasco on it I woke up the flava.

Anyway to sum it up the food was great the server was friendly and the place was clean. I'll be returning to this little spot soon to try many of the  other items on the menu but, at the mean time the Fat Choy burger will be the number one thing I'll be back for.

My family and I have gone to this place so often that we're regulars. All the waitresses and the owner know us. The quality of the food is still so damn good after all this time! Never been disappointed when we go to this place. Awesome service feel very homey. We usually order the fat Choy burger and the shortrib grill cheese and it's the best here. Juicy and decadent, the patty is crispy yet  so juicy inside just about medium to medium rare. I have no words to describe the shortrib grill cheese it's amazing. Definitely will take anyone I know here.

Tough to review a restaurant like Fat Choy.  The food was overall good.  The ambience was terrible.  I think there are some restaurants where the food is so exceptional that the ambience doesn't matter.  Fat Choy doesn't fall in that category.  

The restaurant is in a pretty sketchy part of town where the parking lot isn't secure with guards.  You step into the Eureka Casino and all you smell is cigarette smoke.  But then you walk into Fat Choy and find a cute diner with diner servers.  

Our server was incredibly friendly and nice.  I was initially concerned that both servers were older American ladies who didn't look like they really understood Chinese food, but they certainly made up for it with their friendly service.  

Interestingly the owner was walking in and out of the restaurant but she completely lacked any personality.  We were sitting between two tables who were trying to compliment her on the restaurant and some chef award that he husband won.  It was shocking to see how disengaged she was with these fans.

Fortunately the food was tasty.  We had several orders of the duck bun and an unbelievable pork bun.  The grilled cheese was pretty good too.  

Prices were a bit on the high side for what we got and for the location.  I doubt that we'll return.  

Hopefully they bring back their truck!!!

Man this place is straight outta the movies... SEEDY!!!  I am still perplexed as to why Fat Choy is housed in some weird ass casino!?!?!

PORK BELLY BAO & SHORTRIB GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH ... that's all you need to know.

Order those items and bon appetit.  BTW, our server was pretty cool... asian gal who did a great job describing our dishes.  Just can't remember her name.

So......here is how it went.  All be it I knew that it was in the Eureka Casino, never been there, but its a small hole of a casino on the east side with a more local flavor...yea.  Coursing through the smoke filled floor assaulted by the dinging and toothless chatter of the patrons desperate need for lady luck all wrapped up in a frenzied tornado of weirdness, I spied my destination.  Lets just say not what I expected but hey, good things sometimes sprout out of strange places right!!??  I made my way to the bar as I always do, (it lets me get friendly with the locals and staff and often times I have a VIP front row seat to all the good stuff that is going on in the kitchens...or maybe I'm closer to the tap...Ill let you decide.  

I was greeted immediately by a friendly woman who took my drink order and left me to peruse the limited lunch menu.  Now when I say limited, it was just not like all the other local haunts that have a book full of greasy goodness and slapped together traditionals.  I first started to look for the Shrimp Toast I had heard so much about and well...come to find out it is a special and not on the menu all the time...DAMMIT!!  I moved on to the Crispy Garlic Chicken wings...BAM foiled again, also not on the menu!  So I continued to work the placard menu in hand and try not to be disappointed while the monitor above my head teased of dishes that were, you guessed it, not on the menu.  I was crying by this point into my Stella and the server came with a tissue and said buck up little butter cup you will not be disappointed by the bao.

Whoa daddy.  I had the pork belly bao and the crispy duck bao, (two per order), and I pretty much drooled all over myself just trying to get it all down as fast as I could.  Pretty bomb, folks, with a perfect not spongey bun, the belly was the perfect fat to meat consistency, the crispy duck was a bit stingy (or im just gluttonous), and i rounded it all out with gyoza that was "asi asi" nothing special but had good flavor and was prepared correctly.  I neglected the rest of the menu already deciding that I would come back because I had to order another round of Pork Belly Bao.  What? Don't judge me!

If it wasn't for the guy who just lost $6,000 samolies but still had time to yell into his "brand new" apple watch and listen to Iggy Azalea at full tilt, I-G-G-Y, I-G-G-Y, while carrying on an absent conversation with me throught six teeth, that couldn't quite handle the wedge salad with a caraf of blue cheese he ordered on the side, it would have been a perfect little lunch adventure.  Thanks Fat Choy, Ill be back!! Eat on Amurica!!

One star because after driving across town and arriving during their business hours I was turned away! I arrived and was told that they are closed because of a private party for Chinese New Year. I'm glad that you thought it was a great idea to turn away two locals that might return again and again to accomodate a table of ten. Based on the prices the table is going to garnish the max of $300, but are losing potentially $ 1000's on locals. I probably will never return, considering the mind boggling selection of Asian fusion restaurants I have to choose from. Sorry fat Choy your loss!

Very disappointing.  There were only 2 other couples there on a Saturday afternoon, yet we waited 20 minutes for the first serving of our food, which was my order. My companion was so hungry, he ate part of mine while waiting for his, which didn't come out for another 10 minutes. I ordered pork belly bao and Peking duck bao. Pork beat duck. The rolls were cold, although the meat was warm. The pot stickers came out greasy; had been cooked at too low a temperature. My companion's reuben had thick, salty corned beef, although it was grilled, a plus. Chef Sheridan was not on duty today. Check before ordering. Not worth braving the second hand smoke unless you're going to be rewarded with good food.

I've always respected and admired the Lee family - but when I learned of their partnership with Sheridan, I've decided they deserve more kudos.  This move was brilliant, clever and incredibly savvy since it has the ability to bring an entirely new generation of customers into the property who've never darkened the door - possibly never even considered it before.   

Sheridan's food deserves lots more recognition.  He's hardworking and committed and I love that -- I also like that it's a family affair.

While Sheridan's locations aren't the traditional mainstream -- from beauty shop to smoky casino floor, it's still a tremendous opportunity for him and we wish him all the best because his food is truly made with love and care.  

I think this would be a great location for a Yelp event -- Misty?

Gung Hay Fat Choy!

I went here with high expectations, but I should have checked those at the door of the small, strange casino that this restaurant is encased in. 

The location is certainly not my favorite, but, after reading reviews, I expected a lot worse. Overall, the restaurant was clean, and the service was good. 

The restaurant is pretty small, but there were tables available during lunch on a Friday. 

I ordered the short rib grilled cheese with fries. The bread was barely toasted, and the cheese was certainly not provolone. It was American. The short rib was perfectly cooked: incredibly tender. However, the short rib did not really have any flavor beyond that of beef. I would certainly have liked some sort of chile flavor or spice. 

The fries were thin and on the crunchier side. Not my preference. 

Overall, I won't be back, but it is not bad.

Bao bao and more bao... And some rice lol. Everything was fantastic! It's a bit off the strip but we walked it-or you can take the bus. It is in an older casino, lots of seating and surprisingly bigger that I thought. We had the pork belly and duck baos. We also had the duck rice with fried egg. Delicious!!! Our server was super great and on it. Will definitely returning in town.

Diamond in the rough.  This was definitely worth the trip off the strip.  We tried to sample as much as we could and loved everything.  The Pork Belly & Duck Baos are a must, as is the Shortrib grilled cheese.  Maybe a bit more pricey than you would think, but for one: it's Vegas, and two: it's worth it. The service was excellent; personable and freindly. I expect this place will do quite well with the quality of food and service. We'll definitely be back!

Must try the Baos!! The pork belly bao is a must! The baos are a snack size and they come in twos. The prices are just a little high, but it was worth it. I wouldn't mind going back there for more. 
Their goyza was very good as well. You can tell they made everything from scratch!

Ok so it's in a pretty random location but the best finds usually are. Perfect place to park your butt after a late night on the town for some Peking Duck Bao which is amazing. I also had Sesame Noodles which were fantastic as well. Has a small deli kinda feel but the service is top notch. I will not leave town without making another visit to this place. Yummy !

I absolutely loved this place! My husband and I went to Vegas this past weekend with some friends and before leaving sin city we wanted to have some good yet cheap food and this was perfect! It's located in a small casino and when we first walked in, we got a bit scared, it was such a small place! But the food did not disappoint. 

We ordered the pork belly bao, soft shell crab bao, peking duck bao, wonton soup, chicken and waffles, eggs benedict with pork belly, and a pancakes and sausage breakfast. For 5 of us the bill came out to be $75 including tip! Oh and we ordered coffee too. 

Everything was delicious! The only thing that was just "ok" were the pancakes and waffles. 

We can't wait to come back!

I love Fat Choy. I have been here many times before, however this is my first review for them. The staff is always nice and very courteous. I always order the Fat Choy burger. It is amazing. Short ribs and and egg on a burger make a perfect addition. 

My only complaint is that they close too early during the week. 10pm during the week is way too early, especially for being in a casino. When I want some late night grub I have to go somewhere else. 

I am a big fan and look forward to trying out some other items on their menu in the future.

I have to say,  I know Alot of great little hidden gems but today I found a new one.  Fat Choys is located in a divey little casino but once in there it's decorated uniquely and super cozy. Our waitress was sweet and friendly and I will put this on my list of fav places to eat.  The best pork belly bao I have ever had,  the pork is so tender and flavorful it's ridiculous.  The duck bao is just as good,  you have to try both.  A friend took me for lunch and it was so good I took my kids all the way back for dinner!! The potstickers were amazing also and I was told I must try the sesame noodles next time.  The short rib/grilled cheese was perfectly crisp on sourdough bread,  my kids had the fat choy burger and that was good also,  I'm not a huge burger fan but they said it was good. .  I loved the place so much I just emailed a request to the food network channel to nominate the show for triple d with Guy Fieri to come out,  hope they pick it!!!

When i got to the parking lot of Eureka Casino, i thought i was going to be mugged. But appearances  should be ignored and good thing i did.  

After watching Triple D, i was hyped on trying out their food.

Walked in, the place looked like a cozy diner.

I ordered a Fat Choy Breakfast and I had to say, taste way better than any other place i've had for breakfast.  Everything was cooked perfectly.   I also ordered their Hot wings and I have to admit, its better than some hot wing joints i've been to.

Then i tried their Pork Belly Bao & Duck Bao... My goodness, way better than those big Chinese restaurants.  The bao was sweet, complemented well with the salty pork belly. The duck was crisp and light. I would honestly eat this all day if I could.  Service was great and would come again.

At first I thought this restaurant was it's own venue, I actually didn't know it was located inside the Eureka Casino. After recommendations from my sister and how she kept stressing how good this place is. I've decided to go here for breakfast. Located inside the casino, so it smells like cigarette. 

It looked like an American diner. The lady in front greet us and said we can sit anywhere. So we sat down and look at the menu. There wasn't much to choose from but my sister recommended the pork belly bao. I love pork belly so of course I would order the pork belly bao after hearing raves about it. I also ordered the Peking duck bao. My boyfriend order the fat choy burger. The burger wasn't anything special. It was okay. The Peking duck bao was delicious. Though I love everything pork belly I enjoyed the Peking duck bao more when I don't like duck as much. 

If I'm back in vegas I would definitely stop by fat choy again because I love their pork belly and Peking duck baos. 

I'm pretty disappointed that they don't have the shrimp toast that my sister told me about because the lady there said that it's a chef special and when the chef feels like making it.

How have I not written a review of this place? Wow.  Well here is my review and, I gotta say, Fat Choy is freaking great! We've been in a few times and had several of there items (pork belly and duck bao, the Fat Choy burger with pork belly, the sparerib grilled cheese, and today's special a pork belly BLT).  All of these dishes are amazing. Service is fast and friendly. In all our visits I don't think a drink cup has ever hit the empty point. This is a great little place hidden away in the Eureka Casino.  It's amazing.  That's really all you need to know.

Chef Su, Jenny, and the Fat Choy definitely brought something new and exciting to the Eureka Casino.  You wouldn't find me there at all if it wasn't for Fat Choy and it's delectable delights.. the casino itself it more of a smoker's club and I'm not really of fan of that =/  I haven't been down in a while (life was busy busy busy) but when I was there, I ordered up the cold noodles and grubbed that up quick.  When I was there I noticed that there were no tofu bao for the veggie eaters like me :( BUT, my buddy that went with me the first time went down for a second time and Jenny was nice enough to let her know that they finally made some room on the menu for it!!  Yes!!  So, once I get out of the tangles of grad school and ready to indulge on another culinary adventure at Fat Choy, better believe I'm gonna hit up that bao and cool noodle!

You won't be disappointed eating at Fay Choy.  The baos are simply amazing...flavorful and perfectly cooked.  My personal favorite is the duck bao.  Chef Sheridan combines a perfect amount of tender meat, crispy skin, sauce, and veggie to create the perfect handheld sandwich.  If you've never had a bao blow you away you should definitely try these.
Noodles, short rib grilled cheese, and his burger are also must haves.
I was there to try the bao and it didn't disappoint. Both pork belly and Peking duck are great. A must try! The lady at the counter is warm and informative as well, hehe.

I'm Chinese - what's not to love about delectable little bao wrapped around tender, delicious duck, hoisin sauce, and fresh veggies?!  They arrive two to an order on an individual paper covered wood plank.  We both had an order, then split a third - so yummy.  

This cute diner style restaurant is inside the Eureka Casino.  Even though there is smoking in the casino, it's a short walk from the casino entrance to Fat Choy, where smoking is NOT allowed.  Yay!  The waitress owner is helpful and friendly - our lunch was very enjoyable.

Definitely recommend - we will return!
One of those hidden gems of Vegas, a very random location. Not busy at all, & the bao's were so good! Always have to stop here when I'm in town

Nice, little fusion find in a neighborhood casino. 

Had a great sandwich and friendly service.  

Great to have some variety and relaxed atmosphere.

I like this place. It's right in the middle of things but feels very homey. The menu is very simple. It's clean and well run. The food is good (not great) and it's real and the portions are generous. We really felt comfortable here.

What's up with all the Stars?  Like three or more Stars!  Really?! 

This place is clean and a cute atmosphere but food is just Okay.  It was our first visit.  There were four of us in your party and we ordered every item on the Snack menu, our main entree included the Sesame Noodles, others had the Short-Rib Grilled Cheese and the other two had the Cheeseburger.  The food was nothing to write home about so I'm confused by why all the high ratings.  Don't get me wrong, the food was not bad but it didn't explode in our mouths either.

This place is great.  The Bao are delicious, the shortrib grilled cheese with extra tomato compote is rich, delicious and filling, and the lunchtime service is kind, prompt, and helpful.  It might not be in the nicest area, but there is security and the casino staff is nice as well.  Beware the working "girls" in the casino lol.

Fat Choy is in the sad Eureka Casino. I had the Pork belly Bao the Peking Duck Bao and the short rib grilled cheese. the Pork belly bao was decent. the fat was melt in your mouth and the meat was pretty tender. it also had a nice crisp exterior. the duck bao was a little too sweet... their hoisin seemed watery and extra sweet. the short rib grilled cheese was super heavy but good. I expected more cheese than short rib but was okay that it was the opposite. The side of fries that came with it were eh, but I was too full to eat them anyway.

Glad I had this place bookmarked.  My bestie also used to go to them when they opened up shop inside a nail salon.  Tucked in a Reno-like casino a little off the strip in the back is Fat Choy's.  Definitely looks a lot livelier in the restaurant.

Our friendly waitress told us that they have the Freestyle machine (the Coke machine where you can combine flavors to make like a 100+ different drinks), so I opted for a raspberry coke even though I rarely ever drink soda.  Our sodas were served in huge mugs and the raspberry coke was so good.  

We ordered the Shrimp Toast ($8) & Peking Duck Baos ($7) to share.  She ordered the PBBLT ($9) & I ordered the Fried Pork Sauce Noodles ($9).  The Shrimp Toast was a piece of toast topped with Chinese sausage, herbs, Sriracha mayo and a beautiful over easy egg.  This was delish!  I love Chinese sausage, Sriracha and an over easy egg done right...so how could I not like this dish?  Just wish there was more!  ;-)  The Peking Duck Baos were made well, a big enough piece of delicious duck (not too fatty) and the hoisin sauce in between the pillowy soft buns.  I think these were better than Chairman Bao's.  I ordered the Fried Pork Noodle because I looked at the Yelp pics and one of them showed it with what looked to be slices of fried pork; however when I got the dish in front of me it was ground pork.  It was like the minced pork and cucumber noodle dish you see at Shanghai restaurants, but the sauce is lighter here.  I still enjoyed it and it was a nice alternative to all the breads we've had in the meal.  Her PBBLT was good too, the belly was cooked a little more though and the mixed greens salad served alongside was pretty darn good for a plain salad I must say.

You must try Fat Choy if you have a car when in Vegas.  It's a great Chinese fusion restaurant that's super affordable and different from what you'd find on the strip.

Bao down, when I come to your town.
Bao down, when I'm westward bound.
Bao down, because I ain't a hater like you.
Bao down, because I eat a little greater WITH you. 

Through the haze of mixed smoke and shady characters.. a bright light shines greater than those of the video slot machines and beady eyes glaring right at you.. in Eureka, at some point, you'll find yourself wandering towards the only restaurant up in this shindig.. a lil' spot in the cut called 'Fat Choy'.

The inside is diner-esque with a few booths, a bar top, a few tables floating center, a dessert case and some TV's. The wall near the entrance has a brief artsy history in regards to Fat Choy. It turns out, the owner(s) are from the SGV (626) which is essentially where I grew up.. so naturally I was immediately intrigued.

Attention: Bao is my new favorite treat, I'm convinced. I could easily eat 3 orders of the Peking Duck Bao without question. I pretend I'm full around other people, but the fat boy inside me yearns to continuously eat and eat. *Wrapped within a fluffy n' soft sweet bao bun, covered in a thick hoisin sauce, cucumbers and scallion; the duck is layered and cooked to a crisp with a succulent inside. Every bite was thoroughly relished. Equally impressive is the Pork Belly Bao, which is covered w/ chopped peanuts, cilantro & pickled mustard greens. The pork is a little fatty, to my liking, and too has a juicy inside that leaves your mouth watery and wanting more.

Short rib rice bowl is a must - the dish can easily serve 2; them short ribs are braised with a tender bite. A knife is not needed, as the meat cuts smooth like butter. Mix that with some white rice and a fried egg, pop open that yolk and let it run! The greens in the bowl don't mix too well with the heavy BBQ section, so you can just shove 'em to the side if you're like me. Aside from that, the meat-y yolkish part was tremendous.

I've found Fat Choy an ideal place to share a few small yet fulfilling dishes with friends just a little off the Vegas strip. We were able to try most of the menu upon my last two visits; both times the service was great, the food had my taste buds tinglin' and I left with a satisfied stomach.
The food is OK the staff is very friendly not as great as it sounded on Triple D's show.

My friend Ray took us here. It's totally off the beaten path in a random casino, but that adds to the appeal.  Ordered the Short Rib Rice...Very tasty!!...Very!  Great little spot, will definitely return to try other dishes.

This is one of those Vegas local "secrets".. The place that you bring your favorite friends and family when they visit. This is not fancy, but delicious and made with love and attention at all times. The bao are inspired and perfectly fluffy and sticky every time I order them, the shortrib is tender and sweet, the burgers are classic and always amazing. We usually share an app or two, then also share one of the inspired sandwiches with fries. Our favorite is the shortrib grilled cheese with tomato dipping sauce. You will not regret this masterpiece. Another usual special is the pork belly BLT.. With both their smoked and seasoned pork belly and delicious bacon on a wonderful sourdough toast how could it be anything but wonderful? The Peking duck bao is pictured below, order it and thank me later!

Items selected:

Shrimp Toast - Chinese Sausage, Herbs, Sriracha Mayo, Fried Egg
Duck Bao - Cucumber, Scallion, Hoisin
Chicken and Waffles - 5pc Buttermilk Chicken Wings, Waffles, Butter, Syrup
Nutella Roti - Malaysian Style Pancake, Nutella, Mascarpone, Toasted Walnuts, Honey

Beginning as a food truck called 'Great Bao' before migrating to the unexpected environs of the Eureka Hotel Fat Choy had been getting a lot of press preceding my trip to Las Vegas and with an all day Sunday brunch menu I decided to pay Sheridan Su's Asian Fusion spot a visit for some early evening dining; second hand smoke be damned, anyplace serving bao, roti, and waffles on the same menu warranted my attention.  Located in the corner of a space best defined as 'questionable' and more appropriately 'seedy' I was admittedly impressed at how separated Fat Choy seemed from the casino and how well the smoke from the slots was excluded from the dining experience and after getting past these issues I was even happier to find the service aspects of the restaurant far better than the typical "Chinese restaurant" and actually on par with many high end places on the strip.  With a small crowd of varying ages and ethnicities I made a simple inquiry about the shrimp toast (not typically on the brunch menu) and was assured the chef would be happy to prepare it and although each dish I ordered was good the funky sausage juxtaposing shrimp and tinged with spicy mayo all melded together with a fried egg was undoubtedly the 'must try' dish of the meal.  Opting next for a crunchy waffle topped with somewhat mundane chicken and a bit of Sriracha spiked syrup alongside the signature Duck Bao - a great rendition with pillowy bread, crisp skin, and snappy pickles all playing for center stage - I think it is safe to say that sticking with less "American" food is in one's best interest, though the fusion focused crisp roti topped nutella, rich mascarpone, smoky walnuts, and ample honey makes me think that perhaps something like a Korean style chicken and waffles could be just the right thing to add to the menu.
It was everything we expected.  The short rib grilled cheese outstanding.  The burger was satisfying with that egg on-top.  A small place with a lot of great food.

I was super excited to try to this place out. I even checked out the menu and was fully prepared with what I wanted to order. 

Like most everyone says in their reviews, it is located in a pretty random spot. I've been living in Las Vegas for most of my life, and have never even heard of Eureka casino. I've driven past it quite a few times, and yet never noticed it. 

To say the least, i was pretty disappointed in the service that I received. The waitress had come to our table, asked for drink our drink orders. My friend and I both ordered a coke. Five minutes later, she brought 1 drink out. What?! She set it down without acknowledging us and walked away immediately. Why she thought that only one of us wanted a drink, I'll never know. It's not like we had waters on our tables or any other drinks with us. She finally came back about 7 - 8 minutes later to take our food order. I ordered the Pork belly BLT as well as ordered the shrimp toast as an appetizer. The waitress came back probably another 10-15 minutes later, and informed me that they can't make shrimp toast anymore. Why it took that long to inform me, I'm not quite sure. There were only two other diners in the restaurant, so the kitchen couldn't have been that busy. It shouldn't have taken them 10 minutes to realize that they couldn't make an appetizer. 

Food was decent. The pork belly on the sandwich was amazing. The only downfall to the sandwich was that my bread was rock hard, leading me to believe it had been sitting in the pass for quite some time. Disappointing to say the least. 

Three stars for the food, and the food alone. Wish i could give it more, but rock hard bread? No thanks. Bad service. Bad experience. Would have wanted to go back to try more of the menu, but the service was just so distasteful, I'm not sure if I will.

5 stars, as far as diners & dives go... pork belly & duck bao need to be on your bucket list... truly.
Had the sesame noodles, ok but not spectacular. Fat choy burger rocks. Not an every day burger but definitely a must try. 
I am very much a foodie & moved here from Texas. Have enjoyed the vast variety of restaurants in Vegas, one of the perks of living here...Having said that, this little diner has some special chow, that you won't get elsewhere. I highly recommend the bao, excellent by my standard. 
And, lastly a shout out to Tammi Jo, service second to none. She is a testimonial to a great waitress.

Fat Choy is a gem hidden in the back of a tiny casino on  E. Sahara, the Eureka, a less than desirable or safe area.  The service and food make up for the lack of ambiance.  Don't get me wrong - the restaurant is clean and the seating is comfortable and casual.  I'm afraid people could be somewhat turned off by the location, but if you want delicious Asian/American comfort fusion head over ASAP.

My husband and I first visited about a year ago.  We always get the pork belly bao ($7), a menu must have.  Thick pan-seared pork belly on soft bao with peanut sauce and pickled greens.  The pork belly is a melt-in-your-mouth crispy delight and the bao are the freshest  I've had. Short rib grilled cheese ($10) is another must have for my hubby.  Generous amounts of tender meat, cheddar cheese and more delicious BREAD.

The other item I was delighted with was the shrimp toast.  A generous portion of shrimp atop a delicate toasty slice of French-ish bread, a tiny fried egg, Chinese sausage, drizzled with aioli.  Much, much different than your Chinese restaurant variety.  Alas, the server told me it wasn't very popular and it is only served as a special now. :(  Same with the bone marrow, not enough orders to keep it around.

Consistently good, fresh, well-cooked food and the friendly and knowledgeable servers keep us coming back.  Recommend for a casual night out with friends, date night and don't forget Sunday brunch. :) Ice cold cheap draft beers (Abita Turbo Dog, Widmer) at the bar! ($2.75)

Just gonna say Horry chit, da fud is too many yum. The price is pretty decent for the quality you get, the service is very sweet and the wait staff was very enthusiastic about the menu. 


GET THE BAO. All of it. The servings are slider size so it's either meant for sharing or buy 2 for a light meal. The pork bao are probably the best I've had and the same goes for the duck which is easily on par with most joints in the LA Valley area. 

The slow cooked short ribs were super tender and the pickled garnish was a nice touch. Add bacon and eggs to help with the flavor. 

The pot stickers are fresh tasting and home made. The wonton soup was very deerrricious as well. 

The daily special was a pork belly BLT which was pretty amazing as well. Didn't have a bad dish at all. 

Love the FAT CHOY logo, it's comical. Soooo not racist :) 


Definite favorite and will come again when I'm in town.

I would come back just for the pork belly bao! It was amazing. The pork belly was tender, the sauce was flavorful, and the bao (bun) was soft and fluffy. I also had the Peking duck bao, potstickers, and sesame noodles, but those were only ok. The rest of the menu looked pretty average also. But the pork belly bao was definitely the star.

It's a little hard to find if you haven't been before. It's located inside the Eureka Casino off the strip, so don't be confused at where your gps is directing you.

Went here for the first time the last time I was in Las Vegas and I can't stop thinking about it! I wouldn't mind planning another trip just to go back for the noodles with pork belly! 
The prices are super reasonable, especially compared to restaurants on the strip and the staff is very friendly. Love the dinner/island/Asian vibe.

Good for what it is. A refreshing taste of unprocessed food in Vegas. This place is in a sketchy, rundown casino (no card games... just slots)  Park in the back. It's in old town Vegas so you can visit the Pawn Stars ship afterwards. The tiny casino doesn't serve any hard liquor.... only beer. It's a place for foodies... And a group of cargo-short wearing guys.

The good was bit below average. I went there as it was one of the closest places with decent reviews. I think the people who rated it high, probably haven't been to Asian or american-asian place before. Pork buns were decent but we had hard time finishing the rice dishes.
Great food as I had the Braised Rib Grill Cheese and the Big Bowl of Won Ton Soup, a gem if a place for a different appetite in Vegas, our server Tammy Jo was a delight also!

Would've given 5 stars had the salad not been just a few pieces of wilted lettuce. Also if you're going to offer salad, put it in a separate container. Also, the chef forgot to put the potatoes in my breakfast order.

Besides that, fair value (I was using a coupon) really great service, smaller place than I expected. May or may not go back. Do enjoy that they have the freestyle Coca-Cola machine.
Restaurant is situated  inside a small casino. Food was surprising delicious, just know if you are on a diet do not eat here.

Located in the Eureka casino. We came on a weeknight and the restaurant was pretty empty. I'm from the San Gabriel Valley, and I thought the food was good for the Las Vegas area but I've had better.  We got the pork belly bao, which was pretty much a gua bao in Taiwanese cuisine. The pork belly was a little dry but the flavor was there. We also got the short rib grilled cheese on sourdough, which was ok compared to other grilled cheeses that I've had.  Would recommend coming here if you want your pork belly fix.

What can I say? I love Fat Choy!

This spirited dive in the Eureka Casino (it's not as scary as it looks outside) is just what the doctored ordered when looking for great comfort food near the Strip but off the beaten path.

It's fusion of Asian-inspired American classics is impressive. The Chinese Short Rib Grilled Cheese is one of the best sandwiches in America! The Fat Choy Burger also amazing as is its slate of Chinese Bao. Particularly the pork belly. You'll thank me!

They also have great noodle bowls as well. The prices are reasonable and it's one of those spots you want to hit while you're in our fair city.

For its location, and what it is, the coffee shop of Eureka. This restaurant deserves 3 mobile stars. Great service, even presenting every item as served. Needless to say the food was delicious. I will be back...many times...in a day even!

I got to try their famous bao sandwiches during my vacation. First of all, way over priced for just 2 small sandwiches. Second, the pork belly really needs to be sliced a lot thinner. It was also quite chewy. They needed to cook that longer. But the duck bao was good. Not the best I've tried, but good.

First of all I came here for the potstickers.  I had read other reviews of these and they were delicious!!!  We also tried the medium hot chicken wings, wonton soup, and the shortrib grilled cheese sandwich.  The restaurant itself is attractive, we were seated immediately and I had already perused the menu online so had a good idea of what I wanted to try.  The BF tried the wonton soup, came with crispies and he said it was very good.  I tasted the broth and thought it very tasty.  We both enjoyed the chicken wings, ordered crispy.  They came cooked just right and they were not greasy,  but were not reallly spicy at all to my taste.  They were still very tasty, I just expected morebite I guess. Next time I will try the HOT ones.  BF wished they had had the hot mustard that some chinese places have but they did not have it here, onlly the srihacha hot sauce.  The potstickers were divine.  I loved the sauce they came with and devoured all of them.  The sandwich was good, but needed more salt.  All in all we left stuffed, happy and wanting to come back.  I want to try more items here, the angus burger and the duck rice.  We felt the meal was tasty and satisfactory.  We will be back!!  The only drawback today was that the service was a bit slow, there was only one waitress and the restaurant was not  very busy.  She was very pleasant but we had to wait for our dishes and the check.

Saw all the reviews and had to come try this place. It's off the strip just right pass stratosphere so no too far. The setup looks like a diner so not a typical Chinese restaurant setup. Which is different.

We ordered all their signature dishes and the portions were a good size and filling. Don't miss out on the pork belly and duck bao! Omg our friends were begging us to bring some back to them but considering our 5hr drive home, it might not make it to them. 
 
We would stop here again for the bao's.
Great little place in the casino great food delicious very cheer full and excellent server try the eClair's yumm

What a terrible disappointment.  

Sesame Noodles with Pork Belly: Below average.  This is the first pork belly dish I have ever had that I thought was downright terrible.  The pork was flavorless, stringy, and though to eat.  The noodles were fine, but how are you going to mess up noodles? 

Short Rib grilled cheese: extraordinary in its mediocrity.  The short rib had good flavor, but this sandwich is small and undeserving of its lofty prude tag.  

The service was odd. Upon arrival we were rushed to make a decision. Upon ordering, or appetizer never arrived, and we watched our main course sit under the heart lamp for several minutes as the wait staff ignored it.  This time insured that our fries were cold and gross and didn't help the rest of the meal at all. 

Can come back, but I would have no idea why we would.

A friend recommended this place. It's in a little hole in the wall "casino". The service is good, they are all really nice.  I had the fat Choy burger without the egg and it was damn good. Only thing I would have liked more was to have a bit more short rib in the burger.  My friends had the short rib grilled cheese and that rocked as well. We ordered desert I had the chocolate cake dessert which was good with the ice cream. I liked the icing on the cake. My friend had the eclair and it wasn't great a little hard maybe too cold from the refrigerator. 
My second trip I'm having the chicken and waffle and the sesame noodles. 
Waffle ordinary nothing special
Chicken perfect with great flavor
Sesame noodles unique flavors but good. A tad bit of heat as well. 
I think the burger and grilled cheese are must haves.

So my husband and I recently came here for dinner. I actually didn't mind that the restuarant is located in the Eureka Casino, it makes these local restaurants even more interesting and keeps snobs away.

We chose different items from their snacks section of the menu. We chose the potstickers, chicken wings, shrimp toast and the duck and pork belly bao. The potstickers were really good, so were the wings, although they are like wings you can get anywhere else. Maybe a ranch/sriracha sauce to accompany them would be nice. The meat on both baos was good, but we thought they could've used something moist in them. Neither my husband or I are experts on baos, we've only tried the twice, so it could be that we aren't used to them. The shrimp toast I did not understand, maybe if I would've eaten it as soon as we recived it, but by the time I tried it the egg was kind of cold. My husband really enjoyed it though, and he is picky when it comes to runny eggs. The service is very attentive and friendly, so that's a big plus. 

All in all it was a decent meal; I thought the prices were a tad bit high considering the location.

Now I was pretty hesitant over my husband's "please can we go it's good look at all the pictures" request to eat here.  It was in some casino we thought had shut down long ago, and when we pulled up I wasn't sure if the entire spot was the restaurant, or if the tiny building actually housed a restaurant AND 200 slot machines lol.

HOWEVER - hubby gets major points for this gem of an eatery.  That pork belly bao was like nothing - NOTHING - before.  I've had great pork belly on its own.  I've concocted my own bao's when we ate out.  But this - with veggies on it?  Did I eat that whole thing?  You betcha bao I did.  Even hubby was surprised.

You MUST get.  I think I convinced him enough to try the duck with me the next time we go.

I love that the server explains the food to you as its served - it definitely adds to the experience.  The burger was delicious and the grilled cheese with short rib was just the right amount (we both even used the tomato dip ... crazy!).  But the BAO is WOW.
(Sorry, too cheesy!)

Great service.  Sounded like they had good desserts, but we were too stuffed.  Also, bonus for having the coke machine with a thousand gazillion (I may be wrong in the math) combos - why can't all restaurants have this?  It's a small perk!

Gahhh, let me go search my players cards for discounted rooms - I don't want to wait too long before grubbing here again!

Other things:
- Not too much seating, but that wasn't an issue when we were here
- Park in the back
- TV's so you can watch the game while you eat

One of the hottest restaurants around is located within Eureka Casino on East Sahara. Before Fat Choy, Chef Sheridan Su (former executive chef at Comme Ca) was serving Great Bao in the most unlikely place; a nail salon. I never tried it back then because I have an aversion to the smell. Dining with salon fumes never seemed appetizing in the least bit. I never tracked down the food truck, and it's taken me sometime to travel to the eastside, but I've finally done it. The Eureka Casino was nicer than I expected and I had heard interesting characters patronize the casino. However, on Sunday afternoon it was clean, quiet and no characters in sight. Not sure what it says about me, but I felt right at home. We strolled back to Fat Choy and took a seat. 

The waitress brought over menus; they had a limited selection and no rice or noodle dishes. We selected the duck bao ($7), and the tofu mushroom bao ($6) after she suggested it over the pork belly ($7). We also ordered the short rib grilled cheese ($10) and the nutella roti ($6) for dessert. We chose a plain old diet coke and diet dr. pepper from their new soda machine with dozens of flavors. Our bao came out first. Duck and pork belly were brought out. The order was wrong, but we stuck with it. The buns are steamed to perfection. The pork belly was fantastic, the fat rendered perfectly so it was rich, tender and filled with that wonderful pork flavor. I loved the freshness from the cilantro and greens, and the texture of the crushed peanuts. This was indeed great bao. The duck was delicious too. The hoisin sauce was light and didn't overwhelm the duck at all. Now, I'm curious how the mushroom and tofu bao would be. Tasty, I'm sure. 

The short rib grilled cheese comes with provolone and cheddar, onion jam and a side of marinara sauce. I'm a purist when it comes to grilled cheese; I'd prefer it with only one type of cheese. I thought the two cheeses made it a bit greasy, the sourdough bread grilled beautifully and the short rib was tender and flavorful with the onion jam. The marinara was thick from the tomato paste. Again, not my preference, but still all the components make and enjoyable sandwich. My husband liked it just fine. My tastebuds just didn't concur. There was nothing notable about the fries. 

The Nutella Roti had me intrigued, nutella, mascarpone, honey and walnuts on roti... what's not to love? The wait, as it turns out. We waited and waited and waited. We would've cancelled had our waitress been around. She conveniently disappeared. We waited and waited some more. It was ridiculous. We asked the other waitress and she said it would be right up. We waited and waited. Finally, the pancake topped with goo was brought to the table. The pancake was incredibly greasy, aside from that the flavors were pretty good, but definitely not worth the wait. I could be more forgiving if it were busy, but we were one of three tables. I'd hope they weren't that far in the weeds with seven diners.

Our patience wore thin; we refused to be held hostage for our bill so my husband went to the counter to take care of it. The eats are pretty darn tasty. I'd return for more bao and I'd love to try the duck rice and potstickers. I certainly hope service will be improved.

Great food!  Clean dining experience!  My favorites are duck bao, crab bao, and French fries -- but everything I tasted was delicious!  Very friendly waitstaff and owners.  Something for everyone. Definitely recommend and look forward to eating here again ~

I was kinda disappointed. Based on all the previous reviews I was so excited to try the pork belly bao and it was just ok. Nothing that wowed me because it was just your typical bao with a piece of pork belly which to me came out kinda dry. My friends got the duck plate that came with rice and it was average. You can get better duck in Chinatown. But I did love the grilled cheese with the short ribs it was so cheesy and they didn't skimp on the short ribs either each bite was filled with meat and cheese. If anything I wouldn't explore the menu and just come back for the grilled cheese to take out. The area is kinda shady too so I wasn't too comfortable being there

Anyone who is a Vegas local knows about this place.  Yes, it is in a casino you've never heard of.  No, that doesn't affect how good it is.  I highly recommend the sesame noodles and the peking duck bao.

I've been a fan of Chef Sheridan since his famous little shop inside the nail salon.  I was very much excited to learn that he finally opened again after being gone from the scene in a while.  Like what everyone else mentioned, this little gem is located inside Eureka Hotel.  Yes, the casino is smoky but trust me, once you're inside the restaurant, you won't even notice the smell anymore.  Plus, the walk from the casino to the restaurant is not very far.  

On this visit, I ordered the baos (both types) and they were delicious.  They weren't as what I remembered them from The Great Bao, but delicious nonetheless.  I also ordered the fried pork noodle and I wasn't much of a fan.  However, Jenny (Chef's wife), noticed I barely ate any of it, offered to remove it from our tab.  I told her i'll just take it home but she insisted that if I'm unhappy about it, she would be more than happy to take it back because she does not want me to have a substandard experience.  She also asked what I thought was bad about it so that she can inform the chefs and improve on it.  I loved that!  I love that they're so attentive to their customers.  I was definitely impressed of their customer service.

Their staff here is awesome! They totally know this menu down pat. So much so your mouth is watering before you order your meal.  We did the fat choy burger (with the egg of coarse) and the duck something. The duck meat was as tender as I have had in a very long time.  The skin however is not served crispy and they ran out of their signature scallion and ginger sauce to top off the meal. And as for the burger it was huge! I think it has short rib meat, angus beef, bacon and we had to add the egg!! Their fries are also yummy. So all in all glad we went. And they were busy! I would just say order their pork products. They seem to be their specialty.

Great comfort food. Accessible Asian fusion. For starters the wife and I ordered the bone marrow as well as the bao. The marrow is topped with onion jam and a side of toast. Succulent, creamy, delicious. The duck bao was fantastic. Crispy, sweet, fatty  duck skin, moist duck meat. It couldn't be any better. My wife had the short rib rice bowl. The meat was fall off the bone tender, very flavorful. I had the short rib grilled cheese sandwich. Bursting with flavor, sinfully delicious. Our server April was very attentive, very friendly. Overall a great experience and highly recommended.

My friends invited my hubs and I to Fat Choy a few weeks ago.  Unfortunately, they were closed for a private event.  I was super bummed as I had been craving bao buns the entire day!  Opportunity presented itself again.  Looking back I can't help but feel that the cosmos was trying to intervene and keep us out if this place.  I have to agree with the reviewer who described the smoke gauntlet you had to pass through at the Eureka to get to Fat Choy.  Upon entering we saw an Asian man in a chef coat leaving.  We guessed that was Chef Sheridan.  Uh oh...

Our server was friendly was patient as we tried to figure out how many of each thing we needed to satisfy our ravenous bao cravings.  We settled on two of each duck bao, pork bao, bone marrow and short rib rice.  We also ordered the potstickers and the sesame noodles.  The good: the potstickers and the pork bao, although according to the video of menu items showing, we were missing some key garnishes.  The bad: The bone marrow was not bad itself, but the floppy sourdough (why sourdough?) that came with it was a huge miss.  I've had the bone marrow at Comme Ca where Chef Sheridan came from and this one pales in comparison.  It was like the Walmart version.  The duck bao was not only missing all the garnishes, they seemed to be missing the duck.  It was a hoisin-like sauce and crispy skin.  That's it.  Not even enough skin to make it worthwhile.  Next up the short rib rice.  It came out cold.  Also it was missing the pickled mustard greens, which were substituted terribly with mixed salad greens and I'm pretty sure, straight up balsamic vinegar.  According to some of the other reviewers pics, we were missing some other garnishes too.  I was so jealous when I looked at those pics because that is not the food we got.  I wish the server had told us ahead of time that they were out of these items.  It's not like they were busy.  It was a Wednesday evening and two or three other parties were there.

Not sure I'd give this place another chance.  Chef Sheridan, you need to let the bottle blond with the neck tatoos go, 'cause she is not doing your food justice!

This place is amazing- the area is fine and they have secure parking. The food is made with care the owner literally is also a waitress who understands customer service. This place cares about their clients and the food they make one order at a time. For a local this is a must for those who are on vacation and tired of eating at the same overpriced cookie cutter places on the strip take a cab here for a casual dinner. I went with the duck Bao, short rib grilled cheese and a wonton soup. This place could be in the Wynn tomorrow if they wanted to sell out. Trust me eat here.

Dumplings are as good as they look and the teriyaki rice bowl was great. Sticky rice and chicken. Fried egg could have been a wee bit more fried but delicious nonetheless.

This place is off the strip but worth the 10 minute drive.

CHOY BURGER was the Best burger I've ever had and I've had thousands! Holy mother of God,  how could it get any better? Easy,  order another one!  Now my go to joint in Vegas is FAT, or should it be "phat"....... THANKS GUY!

I have no idea what happened between March 2013, when Niyen wrote his review raving about the Fat Choy burger, and now, but the burger is completely lackluster and worthy of absolutely zero accolades.  

The patty was cooked to a perfect medium rare, and there was an egg on it, but that's about all I can say- visually, yes, there was short rib, but it didn't have any flavor. The other ingredients mentioned on the menu, bacon and roasted tomato? So sparingly applied that I didn't even detect them. Niyen's original description includes onion jam, and that is now missing from the menu altogether, but that bright bit of acidity would have cut through the fat and added a pop of flavor. As I ate this burger, I was asking myself why I was continuing to eat it. That's how underwhelming it was.

The bao aren't noteworthy either, though. Everyone does a pork bao so I opted for the peking duck and the tofu-mushroom versions here. Visually, the tofu-mushroom is already unappealing, with a square sheet of tofu falling out of the bao and minimal stringy mushrooms. Taste wasn't bad, but I wouldn't rave about this to any of my vegetarian friends. And the duck meat on the other bao was dry, accompanying sauce was unremarkable. Everything was very one-note.

Service was polite. I'll add that if you sub a salad for your side of fries (with the burger), it's literally a handful of spring mix salad blend: no tomato, no cucumber, nothing else at all added. 

If using a card, payment is processed through Square (or a similar product/service), and you are presented with a tip percentage page- I'm kicking myself for selecting a $3 tip for absolutely zero service and mediocre food to boot. Never again.

If you're one of those people that loves watching or "Top Chef", "Hell's Kitchen" or "Check, Please" not only to get your food porn fix, but to hear a great story behind the restaurant, you must make a trip to Fat Choy.

You can read all about Sheridan Sui here, http://fatchoylv.com/press, but simply put: this guy knows how to make bomb food in the most random of venues. Prior to Fat Choy, located in a less-than-impressive Vegas casinos, Sui was cooking up buns in a nail salon. And people lined up out the door to taste. It's gotta be good, right? 

Don't let the smoky, seedy Eureka Casino fool you... this is gourmet Asian fusion. With a few American staples still on the menu from the coffee shop who used to inhabit the space. It's very odd to see old, trucker-looking dudes hanging out here. But it's a dichotomy that I'm willing to wrestle in exchange for a gourmet bowl of sesame noodles, plate of shrimp toast (with egg on top), bone marrow or PBBLT (pork belly, bacon, lettuce and tomato). Gluttonous and divine.

Check out the menu: http://fatchoylv.com/food, by most people's standards, this food is CHEAP. Depending on the time of day or how busy the kitchen is, there could be a bit of a wait. But really, you can't rush noms like this. Just order a Kirin from one of the waitresses and she'll bring it to you in a tall, frosted mug. 

Definitely not part of the sexy Las Vegas strip, out-of-towners should call a cab to get here. Sure, you could walk but the heat will likely do you in before you make it in one piece. And you won't want to drag a food baby back with you, either. Go here for the non-traditional Vegas foodie experience... certainly off the grid and worth an adventure.
Lunch is not that impressive  ismall menu if you're in the area it's worth checking out but otherwise forget about it.

Had the pork belly bao, pot stuckers, and sesame noodles. The bao was so good, i mean, it's like fat bacon. I really enjoyed the sesame noodles. I didn't care for the pot stickers but my lady says they're probably the best she ever had so if you dig em, try em. The casino is very rinky dink but don't let it distract you from the food here. Gotta go back and try other stuff, like the peking duck bao

Fantastic food, our group had the Pork Belly Bao, Peking Duck Bao, Fat Choy Burger, Short Rib Grilled Cheese, and the Classic Cheeseburger, they were all great! 

Don't let the shady looking casino turn you away from the restaurant.  Amazingly attentive staff at the restaurant.   One of my favorites in Vegas now.   Definitely will be returning!!!

This has got to be one of the smallest Chinese restaurants I've visited but it is everything that is chalked up to be. The won ton soup tastes like soup I used to get when I was a child and the braised short ribs reminded me of my Grandfather's (who is Chinese). So many childhood memories brought back by awesome food. I definitely recommend the pork belly bao and the braised short rib rice.

Even though I had seen this restaurant on food network and the rave reviews on yelp, I honestly wasn't expecting too too much when I came here with my Chinese family looking for a decent Chinese vote. Was very pleasantly surprised: the pork bao and wonton soup were both very traditionally made; were arguably better than something I would find in the 626. We had the shortrib grilled cheese and signature burger, which while both on the heavier and greasier side were extremely satisfying and very fairly priced. Great food would come again

So this place is definitely a place to visit. It is more along what I would consider a whole in the wall. That being said don't expect the red carpet to be rolled out and don't bring your first date here!  What you can expect is some pretty good eats!  We indulged in the pork belly, duck and soft shell crab buns. All very tasty and well executed!  Then to my favorite.... simple,but full of flavor and as I sit here and write this review I can still taste the short rib in the grilled cheese!  Truly perfection within such a simple thing. If you like grilled cheese and short ribs this a must try!!  We had the duck rice bowl with an egg which was yummy as well.  All in all a good  Oh and they have Jarritos!!! lol
Bao was very good. Services was excellent as the server explained what was and how the food was prepared.

If you've never been here, just go.  Don't be scared off by the strangish casino location.  The restaurant has a cozy diner feel.  Very clean dining area and friendly staff.  Get the short rib grilled cheese.  Half fills me up but it is sooo good it's hard to stop eating.  I love their fries.  They are like matchsick crispy yum. If you are a fat fry person these aren't them. 

I have been here for lunch and late night.  All times good.  Check it out.

I had there lunch special sandwich and it was really delicious! The meat was very juice and tasty. I'll definitely remember the customer service experience! Tammi was a very friendly waitress and had such an amazing positive attitude!

This location of this place is not for the faint of heart. Not only it is located well off the strip but it's nestled inside a really seedy casino where I would not venture to alone.

Besides that fact, the food is definitely worth the trip! Although we tried several of the entrees (short rib rice, grilled cheese w/ short ribs), the star is truly the baos. Specifically, the duck and pork belly baos. I've eaten duck baos at Chinese restaurants but the ones at Fat Choy are the best tasting ones I've ever had. The duck piece had a perfect amount of crispy skin/fat and just a splash of hoisin sauce. High quality ingredients prepared in a clean, simple way!

Inside the small Eureka Casino, Fat Choy's is a perfect blend of American Diner meets Asian comfort food. 

When we dined there it was a rainy Saturday night, which meant the restaurant was pretty empty. People don't go out in the rain I guess. From my yelp research and with assistance from the server, we ordered the short rib grilled cheese, pork bao, sesame noodles, and a wedge salad (to be 'healthy').

The grilled cheese was by far the stand out. It was exactly what I wanted it to be. It had that good 'merican taste combined with rich short rib. It came with a side of tomato dipping sauce to cut some of the richness. Maybe it's the Asian side of me, but I would have preferred a pickled veggie on the side, like some kimchi or cabbage to cut the richness. I guess I needed more vinegary than what the tomato-y sauce offered. 

The pork bao was delicious! The bao were nice little fluffy pillows on which the pork belly could rest. 

I wasn't a huge fan of the sesame noodles. It was a pretty big portion and I got tired of them quickly. I wanted them to have more sesame oil on them and I thought it also could have benefited from more veggies like cabbage or sprouts to contrast the noodles. But, they weren't bad and I could see why people like them.  

I had a great time at Fat Choy and I'll be back for the really friendly/enthusiastic service, short rib grilled cheese, the bao, and whatever other creative menu items might be on for the day.

The people were nice, that is why two stars. The atmosphere was clean and comfy ok I will now give it three stars. The service was spotty at best had to get up and get our own ketchup after long wait. We had duck bao sliders, side of fries, and grilled cheese. Spent $25, left hungry, duck was gamey and unappealing, fries were bland & cold but replaced promptly, asked for salt to boost the flavor of the fries and were handed a salt shaker that had gotten all wet previously, then dried, and didn't work...ick. The onion jelly and tomato dipping sauces were superb that came with the grilled cheese, but my hubby didn't think the sandwich was worth the hype.
Despite being located in the Eureka, the food is really good! The pork belly buns are so delicious. The rice dishes we had were ok, but would definitely go back just for those buns.

Drawn in by the pictures of the short rib grilled cheese sandwich, I dragged Mel C. to the Eureka Casino to check out Fat Choy.  Bigger than I imagined it would be, the restaurant spot itself was clean and had a few flat screens on the walls showing various sports.  Our servers were attentive and the sandwiches (we had the same thing) were delicious.  Throwing caution to the wind, we even had fries on the side instead of salad---I mean, really, if you're going to clog your arteries, you must commit all the way.  Having said that, I think Mel would agree that we must now do our penance at the gym for partaking of such a meal, but it was well worth it.

Fat Choy's been on my list of places to go ever since I saw Chef Sheridan Su on Food Network's Chopped. It's located inside this really small casino that's off the strip. 

I came here early in the day because I've had too many missed opportunities to go, and didn't want to possibly jeopardize my chances with a wait to get seated. I came right before the lunch rush and was able to get great service. There seemed to only be 2 servers working, but they were quick and good at what they do. They had one of the coca cola freestyle machines so the drink possibilities were endless and our server was nice enough to list me all of the options. 

We ordered the pork belly bao and the peking duck bao to start. And then I had their daily special, the pulled pork sandwich and my boyfriend got the duck rice. The baos were what drew me to Fat Choy and they definitely did not disappoint. I also really liked my pulled pork sandwich, it's the same pork they use in their baos but it's been cooked over night and seasoned with their own barbeque sauce.

I was thoroughly impressed by the food, and totally surprised by the 50s decor, at Fat Choy. Was completely expecting a little  hole in the wall (being it's housed in the Eureka Casino) but it's well lit with a playful ambiance. 

The duck bao was delicious- crispy and incredibly balanced. I loved the crunch of the cucumber too and the flavor of the green onion. A must have.... Our very sweet server suggested the short rib grilled cheese, being that it was a staple on the menu and it was our first visit... It's phenomenal! The tender short rib is fantastic and the cheese had that melty comfort required to nail a grilled cheese. 

We also tried the sesame noodles and while they were tasty, they were a little spicy for my taste and wish I was forewarned. #whiner I can't wait to come back and try more items. This place is a new favorite!
Pork belly baos=delicious Duck rice=tasty Short rib grilled cheese=best grilled cheese ever!!! Definitely a must. Although, I wish they had a better dessert menu."

I am HERE, every YEAR.  I have been coming to this spot since I saw Sheridan on "Chopped" back in the day.  We take our yearly pilgramage on my b-day and go from the Deserts of "Palm" to the Deserts of "Vegas".  This is one of the joints we ALWAYS hit up.  Sheridan has been there every single time slaving away in the kitchen making "Ono Grinds".   Always have to have at least two pork belly bao each.  Last year I brought my boy Dean and he asked me earlier this month, "We hitting up Fat Choy this trip?"  I said, "Hellz Yeah".  Food is excellent, service is great.  I can't wait to sink my teeth into his yummy bao.  I had the Pork Belly BLT last year, I hope he has something new and delicious on the menu.  If not, I gotta try the grilled cheese this year.  Anyways, the bao is full of flavor.  It has a nice crunch, a lil bit of greens.  So yum.  My only complaint.....the smoke.  Aside from that?  This place is awesome.  I am kind of bummed that they had him on DDD recently.  It probably means he's gonna be hella busy when we visit him this Labor Day weekend.  I still can't wait!
Great restaurant!  Come and try the the Fat Choy burger.  Quick and friendly service :)  will visit everytime I come to Vegas!
Went here Tuesday for lunch. Sat there for nearly 10 minutes no service no menus. Just walked out too bad because I wanted to try food.... but can't give my money to such bad business.

Vegas is full of hidden gems, and this is one of them. Nestled inside the small Eureka Casino is a cute American-styled diner wirh a decidedly Asian flair.

I had two "snacks" as my entree: a pork belly bao and a Peking duck bao. Both had perfect ratios of fillings to steamed buns, and while I thought I would prefer the duck, I actually liked the pork belly better. There were two baos per serving, so these four small sandwiches were a perfect portion size.

My husband had the Fat Choy burger. He lives by the credo of ordering a restaurant's namesake dish, and his gut served him right again. That was one delicious burger, topped with bacon, short rib, cheese, tomato, and a fried egg. It was one of the sloppiest burgers I've sampled, but also one of the best. And, surprisingly, the hit of the meal for me was the side of fries that came with the burger. Thin cut and seasoned with salt and pepper. Get a little burger drippings on 'em, and you're good to go!

Our waitress was super friendly but not overbearing. And while the drinks were kind of pricey, a table of nearby diners grabbed a couple of pitchers of beer from the nearby casino bar. Savvy!

When we return -- and, oh yes, we will -- I have my sights set on the duck rice and roasted marrow, and my husband has a hankering for the PBBLT (yep, a pork belly BLT). And who knows; there may be a pitcher of Bud Light in our future as well!

I really enjoyed my meal and experience here. The location is a little odd but in a way makes it that much more unique and endearing. Service was good except being told soup would take a few minutes. Really!! soup!!

We ordered the soup of course, and I ordered the PBBLT. The PBBLT states it is pork belly and Bacon with lettuce and tomato. The taste was good but I expected more of the pork. I wanted a real thick sandwich. Our party also ordered the Duck Boa, Short rib grilled cheese and pork boa. I enjoyed the wonderful greasy tastiness of the sandwich which i think was thoughtfully prepared. 

Fluff  Ice was doing a POP UP here as well. Fluff Ice I wish I could explain, but you have to try it whenever you have the chance. It was a great night with great friends and I really enjoyed the quaint atmosphere. The service staff was friendly and even though busy they were good about filling drinks and checking on us.

for more review of our night see Samantha G. review.

The Fat Choy is by far the most fabulous burger in East Side of Vegas or quite possibly all of Las Vegas.......only 1 other rivals it and it is in the far SW.  The Bao's are the best "especially the pork belly" and the service has been wonderful each & every visit (thus far 5) and many more to come because we gotta get us some more yum:)

So, I've been to Fat Choy three times. 
First: my husband and I ordered the famous bao, pork belly and peking duck. We both like the pork belly better, it's really really delicious and deserves 5 stars!

Second time I went alone and had Zha Jiang (ground pork sauce) Noodle. It was ok, not bad but it was too greasy and could use a little more heat.

Third  time I went there and bought the PBBLT to go. It was all good until I saw a HAIR!!!!! Could not revamp my appetite eventhough the burger was really tasty!

Long after that incident, I was in the area and decided to go again. This time I ordered Sunday's special which is Fat Benedict. It's 2 poached eggs, crispy pork belly, rosted english muffins with hollandaise. Sounds good, right? Right, except that the benedict never made it's way to me. I waited for around 10 or 15 minutes before Jenny came and told me that she forgot to put in my order but the benedict will be ready pretty soon. So I wait and I wait for another 15minutes. Then Jenny and the other waitress came up to me and admitted that there's been a huge mistake & they gave my benedict to another customer who just came in. She told me that if I wait again, she'll give my meal for free. Hell no, I don't have the time! So she wrote me a comp voucher ($10 value) instead. 

So between that last bad experience, the hair in my food, and the delicious bao; the question remains; will I go to Fat Choy again???

I knew I was going into a casino so I was not too fussed as I walked through the dark smoky slot machines. When the very friendly waitress gave me the menu my heart fell. This is not an Asian restaurant per se but we were tired and starving and I was not in the mood to find another place. 

The menu is small (which is my preference) and offers a few starters, a few Asian inspired and a few sandwiches. We ordered potstickers while we were figuring out what else we wanted and they were quite possibly the best potstickers I have ever had in my life (handmade daily from the chef's grandmother's recipe).

I ordered the Duck with rice, my son ordered the pork belly sandwich and both were delicious. Seriously delicious!

The wait staff were great. 

All in all, a great choice for lunch :)

Started from 626 Monterey Park and now it's here! Braised pork belly baos are unlike anything you've ever tried. 

Love the hole-in-the-wall vibe, usually not crowded and great service. Food is greasy and cheesy, to be expected if you're ordering Burgers, Grilled Cheese, and Quesadillas ... noodles are good, too. 

If you can make it off the strip, this is a must go to place.

Ordered the pork bao & duck bao to go just now.  Arrived at the hotel and the duck in my bao was just a tiny bit larger than a quarter! For $7 For 2, I definitely expected more than bread & pickles... was the cheat because we were doing takeout? Wonder who the chef was today. Pretty shady.

Another place I've had bookmarked for a while is Fat Choy. Located in the Eureka Casino, this place is a hidden gem!

Pot Stickers (4/5)

Seriously, some of the best pot stickers I've had in this city. Each plate comes with 5 large pot stickers for $6. Unlike many other places, these pot stickers were not soggy at all. They were nice and crispy and full of flavor!

Braised Short Ribs (4/5)

Check out the pics for the portion size! Very generous portions here! The actual meat its self was very tender and juicy. Our server informed us that the teriyaki sauce is actually made on site. The sauce was tasty, but not overpowering. Very filling portion!

Teriyaki Rice (4/5)
